SANGRIA

An exploration of the Synthetic Era.

Experiences have residual value — value that extends further than mere memories but instead resides in the realm of identity-shaping and storytelling. That is to say, when an experience makes your blood flow, an individual feels compelled to make that experience part of their own life story, and thereby share the story of the experience as part of their own (and now more exciting) identity.

So what’s in your blood? What’s your identity? And what can we add to it to make it pump?
These are our building blocks:

Identity

Brand Identity consists of signs and symbols that clearly demarcate a consumption experience from any other. The ability to distinguish experiences creates handles to make a story part of your own.

Continuity

Continuity is a strong harbinger of reputation, a fact that rests on the unity between what you promise, what people expect and what you deliver.

Ritual

Rituals are an essential part of how human beings create and formalize meaning. The presence of ritual marks out an experience as deeper in meaning - a phenomenon that is true for consumer experiences, as well.

Endorsement

Endorsement is not about celebrity — it's about how the meaning and intensity of a brand experience natu- rally lead to credible people organi- cally endorsing it.

Sensory Oddity

Sensorial Oddity is about challenging our senses with something extraordi- nary, marking an experience as unique.

Myth

Myths are the narratives that become part of the very fabric of a consumption experience. They pro- vide a ramework important clues as to who the brand is and where it came from.

Product Offering

Exclusive Product is about allowing consumers to create an experience that asserts and actualizes their indi- viduality; to, in a world of seven billion people, feel and be unique.

Tribalism

Tribalism is about the power of a brand experience to inspire the association of like-minded people.

Lost in perpetual dependency, inhabitants of the Synthetic Era found solace in cryptic simulations, where pain ebbed and cognitive loads momentarily lightened.
